intro: Rapuntium surinamense, commonly known as Surinam buttercup, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive cup-like structure. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy environments and has palmately divided leaves. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to spread and colonize new areas effectively. The flowers bloom in spring and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
